comment: class is mostly made up of research and culminates in a research paper. Not to difficult but you have to put in effort to get an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hes a good professor, he knows his stuff and if you ask him for help hes always willing to help, would take again!

Professor Adesina is a great professor. He really cares and knows what hes talking about when he lectures. Most of the time, he doesnt use up all of the class time and he lets you work on all of the assignments in class. He is really easy to talk to and is very willing to help out. The class is a breeze if you just do the work and go to class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is by far the best I have ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and devotes endless hours giving personal feedback. For the research paper he breaks It up into sections having each part due as you learn it. This lessens the workload and enhances each part. Overall an amazing teacher that made me love writing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Very Caring professor and very straight to the point. Participate in class and stay on top of class work and you will succeed
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I took him both semesters my freshman year and loved the class. He gives a good feedback and seems to really know a lot about what he's talking about. The entire semester is devoted to working on the final research proposal/essay and gives it to you step by step. This really takes a lot of stress off you and gives you plenty of time to get it done!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a great professor. If you come to class and do your work the course is very doable. Hes very responsive to emails and will give feedback on assignments when you ask for it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: He changed for the worse from his fall semester(first semester as a teacher) reviews. He no longer cancels classes, instead choosing to not show up until 50 minutes into class and STILL take attendance. He has done this multiple times. He assigned a paper on a problem with our major, and then required 10 academic sources, which don't exist for mine

He does try and help when he can. Hes a new professor so some things are still a little slow but youll still get them in time. Hes a little tough on grading the papers but give extra credit. You will pass if you show up, do the assignments he assigns , and do whats expected as a college student. Taking him again for 1102

If you don't skip class and you pay attention then you'll get an easy A. It's very important that you always check D2L, though. He tended to cancel the class a lot, so whether that's a pro or con is up to you. However, I was part of his very first class, so he may change in the future.
